intro: Pseudodicliptera coursii, commonly known as the African sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy environments, exhibiting a clumping growth habit with narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowering stems bear small, clustered inflorescences, and it plays a role in stabilizing wetland soils. Due to its ecological importance, it is often found in swampy areas and along riverbanks.
